definition.procedurexml: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?><xml xmlns="https://developers.google.com/blockly/xml"><block deletable="false" type="event_trigger" x="0" y="0"><field name="trigger">no_ext_trigger</field><next><block type="block_nbt_num_set"><comment h="80" pinned="false" w="160">for the BASEcore block in On Right Clicked this tag uses that tag which is dynamic so the size of the zone increases as the base is upgraded</comment><value name="tagName"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT">zoneSize</field></block></value><value name="x"><block type="coord_x"/></value><value name="y"><block type="coord_y"/></value><value name="z"><block type="coord_z"/></value><value name="tagValue"><block type="block_nbt_num_get"><value name="tagName"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT">zoneSize</field></block></value><value name="x"><block type="coord_x"/></value><value name="y"><block type="coord_y"/></value><value name="z"><block type="coord_z"/></value></block></value><next><block type="controls_if"><mutation else="1"/><value name="IF0"><block type="logic_binary_ops"><field name="OP">AND</field><value name="A"><block type="math_binary_ops"><field name="OP">GT</field><value name="A"><block type="block_nbt_num_get"><comment h="80" pinned="false" w="160">each of these if statements draws a line, 4 lines are drawn. using the given zone size for example 2, spawn a particle at z 2 1 and 0, then spawn particle at x. it all comes together to appear like a square is being drawn</comment><value name="tagName"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT">zCord</field></block></value><value name="x"><block type="coord_x"/></value><value name="y"><block type="coord_y"/></value><value name="z"><block type="coord_z"/></value></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0</field></block></value></block></value><value name="B"><block type="logic_binary_ops"><field name="OP">EQ</field><value name="A"><block type="block_nbt_logic_get"><value name="tagName"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT">PassStep1</field></block></value><value name="x"><block type="coord_x"/></value><value name="y"><block type="coord_y"/></value><value name="z"><block type="coord_z"/></value></block></value><value name="B"><block type="logic_boolean"><field name="BOOL">FALSE</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO0"><block inline="false" type="spawn_particle_multi"><field name="particle">CUSTOM:ZoneParticle</field><value name="count"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">1</field></block></value><value name="x"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">ADD</field><value name="A"><block type="block_nbt_num_get"><value name="tagName"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT">xCord</field></block></value><value name="x"><block type="coord_x"/></value><value name="y"><block type="coord_y"/></value><value name="z"><block type="coord_z"/></value></block></value><value name="B"><block type="block_nbt_num_get"><comment h="80" pinned="false" w="160">normally this would just be X and the same for Z. But as the zone increases the zone appears displaced from the BASE block. At the bottom of all of these procdures the X and Z are adjusted to reduce this displaced appearence</comment><value name="tagName"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT">BlockAdjustedXcord</field></block></value><value name="x"><block type="coord_x"/></value><value name="y"><block type="coord_y"/></value><value name="z"><block type="coord_z"/></value></block></value></block></value><value name="y"><block type="coord_y"/></value><value name="z"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">ADD</field><value name="A"><block name="NUM">0</field></block></value><next><block type="block_nbt_num_set"><value name="tagName"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT">zCord</field></block></value><value name="x"><block name="TEXT">xCord</field></block></value><value name="x"><block type="coord_x"/></value><value name="y"><block type="coord_y"/></value><value name="z"><block type="coord_z"/></value><value name="TEXT">zCord</field></block></value><value name="x"><block type="coord_x"/></value><value name="y"><block type="coord_y"/></value><value name="z"><block type="coord_z"/></value><value name="tagValue"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">MULTIPLY</field><value name="A"><block type="block_nbt_num_get"><value name="tagName"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT">zoneSize</field></block></value><value name="x"><block type="coord_x"/></value><value name="y"><block type="coord_y"/></value><value name="z"><block type="coord_z"/></value></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">2</field></block></value></block></value><next><block type="block_nbt_num_set"><comment h="80" pinned="false" w="160">for some reason the x cordinate is displaced but does not displace any more even when the zone increases</comment><value name="tagName"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT">BlockAdjustedXcord</field></block></value><value name="x"><block type="coord_x"/></value><value name="y"><block type="coord_y"/></value><value name="z"><block type="coord_z"/></value><value name="tagValue"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">ADD</field><value name="A"><block type="coord_x"/></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0.5</field></block></value></block></value><next><block type="block_nbt_num_set"><comment h="80" pinned="false" w="160">technically the zoneSize is doubled when drawing the square, so subtracting it to the Z is subtracting half of the zone. The zone appears one block after the BASE block, this nbt tag adjusts the z position of the zone to move backwards half way putting roughly centering the zone over the BASE block. </comment><value name="tagName"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT">BlockAdjustedZcord</field></block></value><value name="x"><block type="coord_x"/></value><value name="y"><block type="coord_y"/></value><value name="z"><block type="coord_z"/></value><value name="tagValue"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">MINUS</field><value name="A"><block type="coord_z"/></value><value name="B"><block type="block_nbt_num_get"><comment h="80" pinned="false" w="160">this value is actually doubled in when it is set, so really zoneSize is half of the actual size, for example if zoneSize is 2 in the procedure 4 will be used. However here it is not multiplied by two becuase we need only half of the zone size</comment><value name="tagName"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT">zoneSize</field></block></value><value name="x"><block type="coord_x"/></value><value name="y"><block type="coord_y"/></value><value name="z"><block type="coord_z"/></value></block></value></block></value></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></statement></block></statement></block></next></block></statement></block></next></block></statement></block></next></block></next></block></xml>
